tic_tac_toe package¶

Submodules¶

tic_tac_toe.test_tic_tac_toe module¶

tic_tac_toe.test_tic_tac_toe.test_main_game(input_values, expected_output, capfd, monkeypatch)[source]¶

Test the main game loop with different sets of input values and expected output.

This function runs multiple test cases to simulate games, providing input values as if entered by players and checking if the game behaves as expected.

Parameters:

  • input_values (list) – List of strings representing player input.

  • expected_output (list) – List of strings representing the expected output.

  • capfd (pytest.fixture) – Capturing the standard output.

  • monkeypatch (pytest.fixture) – Mocking the input function for testing.

Returns:

None

tic_tac_toe.tic_tac_toe module¶

tic_tac_toe.tic_tac_toe.check_win(board, player)[source]¶

Checks if a player has won the game.

Parameters:

  • board (list) – A 3x3 list representing the Tic-Tac-Toe board.

  • player (str) – The current player (‘X’ or ‘O’).

Returns:

True if the player has won, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

tic_tac_toe.tic_tac_toe.is_board_full(board)[source]¶

Checks if the Tic-Tac-Toe board is full (no empty cells).

Parameters:

board (list) – A 3x3 list representing the Tic-Tac-Toe board.

Returns:

True if the board is full, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

tic_tac_toe.tic_tac_toe.main()[source]¶

Main function to play the Tic-Tac-Toe game.

The function initializes the game, handles player turns, and determines the winner.

Parameters:

None –

Returns:

None
